"In retrospect," Donald Rumsfeld allows, it's possible there may have been times when more troops could have been helpful.... It is conceivable that several thousand more troops in Baghdad, where most of the media was located, might have at least kept the capital from appearing so chaotic, a perception that proved damaging throughout our country and the world ( p. 664, italics added).
